Dataset-ProjectionDetail: Twin-Swath, each 512.5 km wide, sub-track (nadir) gap of 737.5 km
Dataset-LongName: MetOp-A ASCAT Level 2 12.5km Ocean Surface Wind Vectors
Dataset-LongName-Full: MetOp-A ASCAT Level 2 12.5km Ocean Surface Wind Vectors
Dataset-Description: This dataset contains operational near-real-time Level 2 ocean surface wind vector retrievals from the Advanced Scatterometer (ASCAT) on MetOp-A at 12.5 km sampling resolution (note: the effective resolution is 25 km). It is a product of the European Organization for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites (EUMETSAT) Ocean and Sea Ice Satellite Application Facility (OSI SAF) provided through the Royal Netherlands Meteorological Institute (KNMI). The wind vector retrievals are currently processed using the CMOD.n geophysical model function using a Hamming filter to spatially average the Sigma-0 data in the ASCAT L1B data. Each file is provided in netCDF version 3 format, and contains one full orbit derived from 3-minute orbit granules. Latency is approximately 2 hours from the latest measurement. The beginning of the orbit is defined by the first wind vector cell measurement within the first 3-minute orbit granule that starts north of the Equator in the ascending node. ASCAT is a C-band dual fan beam radar scatterometer providing two independent swaths of backscatter retrievals in sun-synchronous polar orbit aboard the MetOp-A platform. For more information on the MetOp mission, please visit: http://podaac.jpl.nasa.gov/OceanWind/MetOp . All intellectual property rights of the OSI SAF products belong to EUMETSAT. The use of these products is granted to every interested user, free of charge. If you wish to use these products, EUMETSAT's copyright credit must be shown by displaying the words "copyright (year) EUMETSAT" on each of the products used. Special note: as of 28 April 2015, this production of this dataset has been permanently discontinued. For continued access to near-real-time ASCAT 12.5 km data from MetOp-A, it is highly suggested for users to transition toward the MetOp-A ASCAT Level 2 Ocean Surface Wind Vectors Optimized for Coastal Ocean dataset, which is available here: http://podaac.jpl.nasa.gov/dataset/ASCATA-L2-Coastal.
Dataset-ProviderDatasetName: MetOp-A ASCAT Level 2 12.5km Ocean Surface Wind Vectors in Full Orbit Swath
Dataset-Reference: Verspeek, J. A., A. Stoffelen, M. Portabella, H. Bonekamp, C. Anderson, and J. Figa (2009), Validation and calibration of ASCAT using CMOD5.n, IEEE Trans. Geosci. Remote Sens., 48, 1, 386-395, doi:10.1109/TGRS.2009.2027896.
DatasetCitation-Title: MetOp-A ASCAT Level 2 12.5km Ocean Surface Wind Vectors
DatasetCitation-CitationDetail: Production of this dataset has been discontinued as of 28 April 2015. No further versions are intended for release.
DatasetContact-Contact-Provider-LongName: Physical Oceanography Distributed Active Archive Center, Jet Propulsion Laboratory, NASA
DatasetMetaHistory-RevisionHistory: Dataset Policy created for ASCAT Ingestion
DatasetPolicy-UseConstraint: All users publishing with PO.DAAC data from our providers and partners, please add a citation as outlined here: http://podaac.jpl.nasa.gov/WEB_INFO/citations.html. This product is intended for operational use only and has not been thoroughly evaluated for scientific applications. Please use with caution.
DatasetResource-Description: History of Reported Modifications, Anomalies, etc...
DatasetSource-Source-Description: MetOp-A is the first in a series of three polar-orbiting European meteorological satellites,  launched on 19 October 2006 as part of the EUMETSAT Polar System.
DatasetSource-Sensor-Description: C-band Dual Fan Beam European Scatterometer
